question: 氏
userExplanation: goes after a family name in very formal situations. So, it's really closely tied to that
sourceMnemonic: The kanji means <kanji>family name</kanji> because it goes after a family name in very formal situations. So, it's really closely tied to that. Because only men got the respect back in the day, we're calling this vocab word <vocabulary>mister</vocabulary>. You can call me Mr. Koichi if you'd like, too.
sourceReadingMnemonic: The reading for this word is the same as the kanji.
